docs.snippet: Dexter Fowler made a dramatic return to the Chicago Cubs when it looked as if he was off the market. Austin Jackson waited until the beginning of March before signing with the Chicago White Sox....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dexter Fowler made a dramatic return to the Chicago Cubs when it looked as if he was off the market. Austin Jackson waited until the beginning of March before signing with the Chicago White Sox.

docs.snippet: Everyone remembers the overtime marathons in the Stanley Cup playoffs. Maybe it's the Flyers' Keith Primeau scoring in the fifth extra session in 2000 against the Penguins or perhaps it's Nashville's Mike Fisher with the winning goal in the third ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Everyone remembers the overtime marathons in the Stanley Cup playoffs. Maybe it's the Flyers' Keith Primeau scoring in the fifth extra session in 2000 against the Penguins or perhaps it's Nashville's Mike Fisher with the winning goal in the third OT last week against the Sharks.

headline.main: Sudden-Death Overtimes in NHL Ending More Quickly Than Usual

docs.snippet: This Philadelphia group, with zero pretense and almost too much heart, has bounced back with a new album after a member’s near suicide....

docs.abstract: Punk rock band Modern Baseball releases third album Holy Ghost, with lyrics influenced by members' experiences with mental illness and depression.

docs.snippet: For his first 18-hole round in front of a paying public since his meltdown at the Masters, Spieth seemed to be in good spirits — and in good form....
docs.lead_paragraph: For his first 18-hole round in front of a paying public since his meltdown at the Masters, Spieth seemed to be in good spirits — and in good form.
docs.abstract: Jordan Spieth returns from four-week break in Bahamas in which he and three other players relaxed and rejuvenated in preparation for Players Championship.

headline.main: For Jordan Spieth, a Four-Week Break Seems to Heal All Wounds

docs.snippet: Andrew Levy’s parents knew that the rare and deadly cancer in his blood could not be beaten, so they began to prepare for the worst. Then something mysterious happened....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andrew Levy’s parents knew that the rare and deadly cancer in his blood could not be beaten, so they began to prepare for the worst. Then something mysterious happened.
docs.abstract: Spontaneous recovery of 2-year-old Andrew Levy from malignant and generally fatal form of leukemia presents both miracle and puzzle for oncologists; doctors speculate that Esther and Dan Levy’s decision to stop their son's treatment prematurely allowed host of other events to take place and eliminate cancer.

headline.main: When Do You Give Up on Treating a Child With Cancer?
